title: Top Places to visit in Amreli, Gujarat
content:
Amreli is a city and a municipality in Amreli district in Indian state of Gujarat.

 

Amreli district is one of the 33 administrative districts of the state of Gujarat in western India. The district headquarters are located at Amreli. The district occupies an area of 6,760 km² and has a population of 1,513,614 of which 22.45% were urban (as of 2011). From Amreli district maximum number of NRI in USA from Saurashtra. Amreli is land of Yogiji Maharaj, Danbapu, Sage Muldas, Sage Bhojalrambapa, Sage Muktanand Swami, Magician K.Lal, Zaverchand Megahani's place (Bagasara), Dr. Jivaraj Mehata etc. Amreli covers Gir National forest sanctuary area. Now it is developing as a Hub of Education.

 

Attractions

Most part of the commercial area is called Tower Road stretching from Tower to the Main Bus stand and further to Gopi Cinema.

 

Gebansha Peer Dargah

Nagnath Temple (built by Vithalrao Devaji)

Swaminarayan Temple

Trimandir - This temple concept was developed by Param Pujya Dada Bhagwan. Within the temple a tall and attractive idol of Shree Simandhar Swami resides.

Kamnath & Mahadev Temple

Dwarkadhish Haveli

Jafari Mazaar (Bohra Dargah of Jafarji Moala)

Siddhi Vinayak Temple

Guru Datta Temple

Rokadiya Hanuman Temple

Balaji Hanuman Temple

Sai Baba Temple (Sardarnagar)

Gayatri Temple

Sukhnath Mahadev Temple

Rameshwar mahadev Temple

Mahatma Muldas Bapu Dham

Jivan Mukteshwar Temple

Balaji Hanumanji (Rangpur Road)

Dada bhagvan temple

Tower of Amreli

Palace of King

Shri Girdharilal Sangrahalaya Children Museum and Computer Education Centre(E-Library)

Gandhi Baugh (Gandhi Garden)

Kailash Muktidham

Kamani Forward High School

Kamani Science & Prataprai Arts College

Attractions (Surrounding Amreli)

Tapasvini Pujya Vasant Didi Ashram, Liliya Mota

Shri Bhojalram Dham or Bhojaldham near Fatepur, located 7km southerly to Amreli

Pavan dham gaushala, Mota Ankadiya

Garaneshvar Mahadev Temple, Garni

Hanumanji Temple, Charan Pipali.

Bhurakhiya Hanuman Temple, Lathi

Pania Wildlife Sanctuary, Gir

Swaminarayan Gurukul, Taravada

Dhari Khodiyar Dam & Galadhara Khodiyar Mata Temple, Dhari

Balmukund haveli, Dharai

Dhari Gir National sanctuary, Gir

Yogiji Temple, Dhari

Dan gigave ashram and temple or Danevdham, Chalala

Leuva Patel Sankul

Varhaswarup Temple, Jafrabad

Sarkeshwar Mahadev Temple, Jafrabad

Ratneshwar Mahadev Temple, Jafrabad

Lunasapuriya Temple, Jafrabad

Shiyal bet, Jafrabad

Jafrabad Fort, Jafrabad

Pipavav Port, Rajula

Pipavav Dham, Rajula

Ballad Mata Mandir, Rajula

Chanch Bungalow, Rajula

UltraTech Cement Factory, Rajula

Sana Vakya Caves, Timbi

Hanuman Gala, Khambha

Pandav Kund, Babra

Dadva Randal Mata Temple, Babra

Varahi Mata Temple, Savarkundla

Varudi Mata Temple, Amarpur(Varudi)

There is a well near the Government offices, called Bakshi-kua from Nana Bakshi in the time of Vithalrao, who built it.

The Mir Sahib's Haveli was erected about 1850 by Mir Sarfardz Ali; former manager of Amreli, for his own residence.

Notable people

Jivraj Narayan Mehta is first chief minister of newly formed Gujarat state

Ramesh Parekh, famous poet of Gujarat.

Dilip Sanghvi, said to be 2nd richest person in India.

K Lal Magician, a magician born in Mavjinjava village, Amreli district.

Yogiji Maharaj – Sadhu Gnãnjivandas (23 May 1892 – 23 January 1971), commonly known as Yogiji Maharaj, was a Hindu sadhu and guru who is recognized as the fourth spiritual successor to Swaminarayan by the Bochasanwasi Shri Akshar Purushottam

Dina Pathak is famous Bollywood actress & president of National Federation of Indian Women.

Ramesh Oza, is a Hindu preacher famous for Bhagwat Kathakar from a small village Devka near Rajula of Amreli district

Savji Dhanji Dholakia, the Indian diamond merchant from Surat and the founder of Hari Krishna Exports Pvt. Ltd., hails from Dudhala village.

Bhupat D. Bhuva,the founder of Sheetal Cool Products Ltd,one and only BSE(Bombay Stock Exchange) listed Company of the Amreli district.He is one of the biggest employer of the district.

H.H.sankhyayogi Lila Ba,She is a Hindu sant and guru of swaminarayan sampraday and spiritual successor of Mota Ba (Jivu Ba).

 

Divisions

The district comprises 11 talukas.

 

Amreli

Babra

Dhari

Vadia

Lathi

Lilia

Savar Kundla

Khambha

Rajula

Jafrabad

Bagasara

 

Culture

The most popular temples in the city of Amreli are Nagnath Temple, Gayatri Temple and Shreenathji Haveli. The other tourist places in Amreli district are Tulshishyam, Una, Sarkeshvar Mahadev, Balana(Jafarabad), Delvada, Holi-Dharin Nana Visavadar, Vakuni-Dhar, Hanuman Gada, Satadhar, Galadhara-Khodiyar Temple and Khodiyar dam and Kankai.

 

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amreli

subContents.SubTitle: 1. Ambardi Safari Park
subContents.SubContent:
The Ambardi Safari Park situated 7 kms from Dhari, is a Reserved Forest (RF) of Gir Protected Area on the bank of Shetrunji river near Ambardi village. Its undulating terrain, proximity to a large water reservoir and Khodiyar temple make Ambardi a place worth visiting.

 

Ambardi Park Website

 

https://ambardisafaripark.org

subContents.SubTitle: 2. Shiyalbet, Jafrabad
subContents.SubContent:
Shiyalbet village in Jafrabad Taluka is surrounded by Arabian sea and is famous by its natural, ancient and physical sites.

 

It is reachable only by Boat from Pipavav Port.

 

Tourist can enjoy its surrounding Arabian sea , fishermen village culture and beaches.

subContents.SubTitle: 3. RAJMAHEL - Amreli
subContents.SubContent:
Inheritage site of Gaikvad King of Vadodara, the palace is about 170 years old.

This is 2 story Magnificent building having average hight of 10-12 meters.

 

At the time of the royal monarchy, lok darbar (peoples’ court) were oragnised here.

 

The bronze statue of Maharaja Sayajirao is found in the palace of Rajmahal.

subContents.SubTitle: 4. Pipavav Port, Rajula
subContents.SubContent: This port is in Pipavav village of Rajula Taluka about 100 KM from Amreli. It is linked to Mumbai by double-deckor containers by railway line.

subContents.SubTitle: 5. Kalati Tirth -Lathi
subContents.SubContent:
24 km from Amreli At the distance is a poet Kalapi tirth at Lathi.

The works of memories of the royal poet Surasinhji TakhtSingh ji gohil “Kalpi” can be seen in Kalpati Tirtha museum.

 

The inauguration of “Kalpati Titha” was done by Hon’ble Chief Minister Shri Narendra Modi in 2005.

subContents.SubTitle: 6. Bhojal Dham-Fattepur
subContents.SubContent: About 7 km from Amreli in Fattepar Village, place is famous for the seat of Saint BhojalRam, who was Guru and mentor of famous saint Sri Jalaram of Virpur

subContents.SubTitle: 7. Clock Tower
subContents.SubContent: Built during the time of Gaikvad reign

subContents.SubTitle: 8. Nagnath Temple
subContents.SubContent: This temple, located in the middle of Amreli city, is 203 years old. In the year 1802, this temple of Shiva was constructed by Sarsubha Shri Vitrilrao Dewaji, who was managing the Saurashtra as a representative of Sayajirao Gaekwad. This temple is the center of faith and belief of people.

subContents.SubTitle: 9. Bhurakhiya Hanuman
subContents.SubContent: Bhurakhiya Hanuman temple is one of the greatest temple of lathi. Bhurakhiya is a very small village of lathi taluka in Amreli district Gujarat. Bhurakhiya Hanuman temple is a nearby cities Lathi, Palitana, Gariadhar, Babra, Amreli.

subContents.SubTitle: 10. How to Reach
subContents.SubContent:
By Air

The nearest airport from Amreli is Rajkot, situated at a distance of 112 km from the city. A number of flights fly to and from here, connecting the city with the various parts of Gujarat as well as the country.

 

Amreli also has a small airport connecting with Surat with 9 seater plane

 

By Train

Amreli City is not having good train connectivity. Only meter gauge trains connecting Amreli with Veraval and Junagadh. Broad Gauge connectivity to Ahmedabad is from Lilia and Savarkundla which is 15 and 35 Kms from Amreli.

 

By Road

Amreli is linked to the rest of the country through a good road network. There is even a good network of  State Highways connecting the city. The State Transport Corporation runs buses link Amreli to all the major cities and towns of Gujarat.

 

source: https://amreli.nic.in

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Vadodara, Gujarat
recommendations.content: Vadodara (formerly known as Baroda) is the third-largest city in the Indian state of Gujarat, after Ahmedabad and Surat. It is the administrative headquarters of Vadodara District and is located on the banks of the Vishwamitri river, 141 kilometres (88 mi) from the state capital Gandhinagar. The

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Kutch, Bhuj, Gujarat
recommendations.content: Kutch district is a district of Gujarat state in western India. Covering an area of 45,674 km², it is the largest district of India.
